title: adjoint orbit of (twisted) loop group
body: Let $G$ be the twisted loop group of $SL_2(\mathbb C)$ and let $g$ be its Lie algebra, where diagonal entries are even functions and off diagonal entries are odd functions (of loop parameter lambda). What are the adjoint orbits in $g$ ? Is the adjoint orbit structure known for all the (twisted) loop groups over complex simple Lie groups? loop-groups Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 15, 2020 at 7:27 Community Bot 1 2 2 silver badges 3 3 bronze badges asked Mar 5, 2014 at 1:47 joe 31 1 1 bronze badge $\endgroup$ 2 $\begingroup$ What sort of structure on the adjoint orbits are you seeking? $\endgroup$ Peter Crooks –  Peter Crooks 2014-03-05 02:05:33 +00:00 Commented Mar 5, 2014 at 2:05 $\begingroup$ I am wondering if there is a normal form for an element in a loop algebra under formal adjoint action.
